H0.text: Absorption is the process by which eyeglasses help a nearsighted person see.

H1.text: Diffraction allows eyeglasses to help a nearsighted person see.

H2.text: Reflection is the phenomenon that enables eyeglasses to help a nearsighted person see.

H3.text: Refraction is what allows eyeglasses to help a nearsighted person see.

A4.text: Corrective lenses bend the light entering the eye in a way that places a focused image accurately onto the retina.

A5.text: Corrective lenses for myopia have negative powers because a divergent lens is required to move the far point of focus out to the distance.
